text: this is the central part of base camp
and this is the spot that was hit the
hardest when the avalanche plowed
through this area forcing all people and
possessions out of the way the process
of trying to salvage some of the
possessions is underway if we move over
here you can see the collection of
Sherpas who've come up the mountain to
try and gather together see the remnants
of a whiskey bottle some bags some tents
we're seeing some camera lenses much of
this has been smashed and much of it has
been moved away up and further down the
valley the air is very thin here it's
very hard to breathe and very hard to
stay warm many climbers have still
stayed here
we can't seize on either side there's
still tents here there are still
climbers here or even hearing that some
people are attempting or at least hoping
that they can still climb everest
although that remains to be seen the
precise number of people isn't known but
we believe something in the region of
five to six foreigners died here maybe
more but more than double that amount of
Sherpas were killed the question now is
what happens to the local community if
the climbing season's canceled and what
happens to the families of the bereaved
